labels.analysis: The StarRocks MCP Server facilitates integration of the StarRocks data analytics database with applications, allowing users to access and manipulate data efficiently. It emphasizes performance and flexibility through a standardized protocol. The core functionality revolves around database operations, with a focus on data querying and system access. The "Optional Settings" tool suggests some level of server management capabilities.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Database Operations" is chosen because the server's main functionality centers around interacting with the StarRocks database, enabling data access and manipulation. "Data Analysis & Processing" is selected as a secondary label since StarRocks is a data analytics platform. "Optional Settings" points to some server management aspects, suggesting "Operating System" as a secondary label.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: StarRocks MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @hagsmand/mcp-server-starrocks
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate StarRocks with your applications seamlessly. Access and manipulate data efficiently using a standardized protocol for enhanced performance and flexibility.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@hagsmand/mcp-server-starrocks/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
